ygData.subject: RE: Training Guards
ygData.msgSnippet: And who said this? ... From: Ligge [mailto:ligge@eqguide.com] Sent: Thursday, September 23, 1999 10:01 AM To: EQCheats@onelist.com Subject: [EQCheats] Training
ygData.messageBody:
And who said this?

-----Original Message-----
From: Ligge [mailto:ligge@...]
Sent: Thursday, September 23, 1999 10:01 AM
To: EQCheats@onelist.com
Subject: [EQCheats] Training Guards


From: "Ligge" <ligge@...>

Well I asked around for some official answers and I was told basically that
blocking, training, etc etc were all ILLEGAL. Plain and simple. End of
statement.

No role-playing excuses allowed. If guides are accepting role-playing
excuses and allowing it to continue then those guides are not following the
rules.

Guards in all areas have loot and give experience. They are there to be
killed. The fact that they protect newbies in their homelands is an added
bonus, but any sort of assistance they are given by players to attack the
people hunting them does go against the PVP avoidance rule.

If people are hunting your guards in your homeland you have no recourse but
to duel them yourself.

Someone wanted to know what was the official answer according to actual
guide rules, so I asked.
\
